717001f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Rector Street
717001f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north from Rector Street, showing Trinity
Church in the background.
1879.

717004f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Rector Street
717004f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, north across Rector Street, showing
prominently Trinity Church and 9hurchyard occupying the front-
age from Rector to Thames Streets. Beyond is the Western
Union Building with clock tower atop.
About 1885
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPPODUCEI

717006f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Rector Street
717006f-a.text:
Broadway,between Rector ani Thames Street,East Side and
at the head of Wall Street,showing Trinity Church,P.E. It
was granted a Royal Charter in I697.
Ref: King's Handbooi bo New York,I892
Pp 341-342
About I890
Detroit Photograph Co.
Copyright.

717026f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
717026f-a.text:
Broadway, north from a point between
Wall and Pine Street'w and across the latter,
showing nrominently the old Ecuitable Building
occupying the 'ine to Cedar Street frontage.
This structure erected in 1872, and enlarged in
1887, .contains the main offices of the Equitable
Life Assurance Society of t e United SEates.
To the right is the 5-story structure
at the N.E. corner of Pine that was included in
the site for the present 21-story American Surity
Co. Building. The structure with a clock tower atop
and on the far side of the Ecuitable Building is No.
134-46 Broadway.
This was the former home of the Yutual
Life Insurance Uompany and subsequently occupied
by the American Fire Insurance Co. Later the
Guaranty Trust Company built there. For a sirilar
iliustration-see King's Handbook of New York 1893-
page 671.
About 1890
:ift of Urbrohk Collection
MAY BE REPRODUCED

716996f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Rector Street
716996f-a.text:
Broadway, st the S. W. corner of Rector Street. Shown
is the building in which the financier Russell Sage was
the object of a bomb explosion that injured an innocent
bystander. This structure was replaced in 1897 by the
21 story Empire Building. On the right is a view west-
ward on Rector Street to Trinity Place. The Rector Street
station of the Sixth Avenue Elevated Line appears there.
At the margin is a portion of Trinity Churchyard.
About 1895
Gift of Urbrock Collection
MAY BE REPPODUCED

717007f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
717007f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, at Wall Street, showing a complete view of Trinity
Church. Also shown is a general view of the lower west side of Manhattan,
with the Hudson River and lower Bay clearly shown. Note the Statue of
Liberty dimly discernible on the right.
About 1895.
Eugene L. Armbruster Colkh ction.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

717008f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Rector Street
717008f-a.text:
Trinity Church,P.E. located on Broadway,between
Rector and Thames Streets,at the hesd of Wall Street.
Copyright in I539 by,
A.Loeffler.

716992f.text:

May 28, 1904
Browm Bros.

717009f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
717009f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, from and including Wall Street, to, but not
including Exchange Place. No. 1 Wall Street, at the S.E. corner of
Broadway, is at the left of Trinity Church.
About 1905.
Irving Underhill.
NO REPRODUCTIONB.

716994f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Rector Street
716994f-a.text:
73-69 Broadway, at the S.W. corner of Rector Street, showing the
21-story Empire Building. The street on the rigEd is Rector Street, of
which this structure forms the south side while Trinity Grave Yard forms
the other. On Trinity Place is a station of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line.
About 1915.
Gift of E.M. Jenks.
Underhill.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717028f.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
717028f.text:
90-94, 96 and 100 Broadway, east side, north from Wall (right) to
Pine (left) Streets, showing 3 structures occupying this entire block
front. They are respectively, the First National Bank, the Schermerhorn
and the American Surity Buildings.
About 1915.
Cift of E. M. Jenks.
MAY BE REPRODUCED.

716991f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Rector Street
716991f-a.text:
73 to 5l Broadway (left), west side, south from and ineluding Rector
Street, to a point slightly south of Exchange Alley, showing the 21-story
Empire Building (Nos. 73-69), the 21-story American Railway Express Co.
Building (Nos. 65-63), and the lower floors of the 32-story Adams Building
(Nos. 61-57). Also shown (right) is Rector Street. south side, west from
Broadway, to Trinity Place, showing that side of the Empire Building.
August 7, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

716995f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
716995f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, at Wall Street, showing the lower stories of four
buildings at the o.E. corner that is the site of tne present 50-story
Irving Trust Co. Building. No. 86-84 is an 18-story structure at the corner.
adjacent to same is an 11-story building, No. 82. Successively in order
are the 11-story Central Union Trust Co. at No. 80 and the 21-story
Century Building No. 74-72.
About 1928.
Herbert Photos Incorporated.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

716999f-b.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
716999f-b.text:
(1)
Broadway (foreground), at the S.E. corner of Wall Street (left)
showing the structures at that location where the huge Irving Trust
Company Bldg. will rise. Note to the left of same, the spire of
Trinity Church. In the background, prominently seen is the 38 storied
Equitable Trust Co. Bldg. The photographer is viewing eastward across
the graveyard of the Church, from No. 74 Trinity Place.
May 13, 1929
P. L. Sperr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS
(2)
A view from the same vantage point after the aforementioned
3emoliton. Across same apnears the rear of the New York Stock Exchange
Building.
Aug. 20, 1929
P. L. Srerr,
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717000f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
717000f-a.text:
(1)
Broadway, east side, at Wall Street, showing under demolition
Nos. 86-84, 82 and 80 Broadway, at, adjoining and south of the S.E.
corner of Wall Street. These in conjunction with adjoining property
formed the site of the present (1937) 50-story Irving Trust Building,
Mnown as No. 1 Wall Street. This view is photographed in an eastward
direction on Rector Street and shows on the left, the southern edge of
Trinity Ceretery, across which appears the 11-story First National
Bank, Ho. 90-94 Broadway, at the N.E. corner of Wall Street. This was
demolished and improved with a 21-story structure slightly later.
January 11, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPRODUCDD.
(2)
A view solely of the future Irving Trust site as viewed south-
eastward from in front of Trinity Church (right).
January 11, 1929.
Eugene L. Armbruster Collection.
MAY BE REPR:ODUCED.
(3)
The same as No. 1 at a later date and viewed southeastward.
Demolition has been completed for the Irving Trust Co. Building and
the steel frame work is rising. On the right appears a clearer view
of the First National Bank, No. 90-94, as mentioned in No. 1.
Augmt 20, 1929.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

August 7, 1929.

(2)

The buildings occupying this block front are, the 21-story American Surety

723833f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broadway
723833f-a.text:
Nos, 2-6 Vall Street, at the N.E. corner of
Broadway as vi wed across the Irving Trust Co. Build-
ing site. This structure, erected in 1880,is occupied
by the First National Bank,tho constructed for the National
Bank of the Rwpublic, when it was better known as''Fort
Sherman.'' For details see King's Handbok of New York
1893, page 724.
The photographer gives his vantage points as
the Stock Exchange (No.1) and the Empire Building
(No. 2). Note in the former the partial glimpse of
Trinity Cemetery on the opposite side of Broadway.
Sugust 7, 1929
Views 1, 2
P. L. Sperr
NO REDRODUCTIONS

717020f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
717020f-a.text:
Broadway, east side, at Wall Street, as seen across Trinity Church
yard and from the W,Y. Curb Exchange Building, showing prominently the
50-story Irving Trust Building, at the S.E. corner of Wall Street and
Broadway. Opposite same (left) is the 21-story structure of the First
National Bank.
November 25, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

717017f-a.title: Manhattan: Broadway - Wall Street
717017f-a.text:
Broadway, west side, at the head of Wall Street. This view of Trinity
Church and grouhds was photographed southeastward, from a point near Trinity
Place and silhouettes the church steeple againstAo.50-story Irving Trust
Co. Building, at the S.E. corner of Broadway at Wall Street. Shown on the
right, are the upper stories of the Empire Building, a 22-story building
forming the south side of Rector Street, between Trinity Place and Broadway.
1936.
W.P.A. Photo.
Federal Writers Project.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

717010f.text:

No, 1 is an enlargement by the photographer; No. 2 being a copw of the

723826f-a.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broadway
723826f-a.text:
No. 1 Wall Street, south side, east from Broadway to New Street, show-
ing the 50-story Irving Trust Co. Building, which occupies this site. This
is viewed southwestward through the clearance for the Bankers Trust
addition and shows the N.E. corner of building concerned.
July 26, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

723835f-b.title: Manhattan: Wall Street - Broadway
723835f-b.text:
(1)
Aaall Street, east from Trinity Church Yard, which is west
of Broadway.
December 1, 1931.
. Sperr  No R8rRbOUcfIONS.
(2)
The same, prior to the erection of the 50-story Irving Trust Co.
Building shown in view 1. On the lower right of this view, the site is
shown being prepared. On the opposite corner (shown under demolition in
No. 1)is the 11-story First National Bank. Towering over this is the
39-story Bankers Trust Co. Building. The modern type structure in the
right background is the 38-story Equitable Trust Co. Building.
August 20, 1929.
Sperr.  Ne RirRbDUCTIONS.
